examples.pinyin: Wǒ chàbuduō dào gōngyuán ménkǒu le.
examples.english: I'm almost at the entrance of the park.

examples.chinese: 电影 差不多 要 开始 了。
examples.pinyin: Diànyǐng chàbuduō yào kāishǐ le.
examples.english: The movie is almost about to start.

examples.chinese: 今天 的 工作 差不多 做 完 了。
examples.pinyin: Jīntiān de gōngzuò chàbuduō zuò wán le.
examples.english: Today‘s work is almost done.

examples.chinese: 你 儿子 差不多 五 岁 了 吧？
examples.pinyin: Nǐérzi chàbuduō wǔ suì le ba?
examples.english: Your son should be about 5 years old, right?

examples.chinese: 他 住 在 上海 差不多 三 个 月 了。
examples.pinyin: Tā zhù zài Shànghǎi chàbuduō sān gè yuè le.
examples.english: He has lived in Shanghai for about three months.

explanation: Used before a number, quantity, or time phrase to express approximation, similar to 'almost' or 'about' in English.

examples.chinese: 我 在 这 家 公司 工作 了 差不多 十 年 了。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zài zhè jiā gōngsī gōngzuò le chàbuduō shí nián le.
examples.english: I've worked for this company for almost ten years.

examples.chinese: 我父母 结婚 差不多 二十 年 了。
examples.pinyin: Wǒfùmǔ jiéhūn chàbuduō èrshí nián le.
examples.english: My parents have been married for about twenty years.

examples.chinese: 差不多 两 个 星期 以前，我 在 北京 见 过 他。
examples.pinyin: chàbuduō liǎng gè xīngqí yǐqián, wǒ zài Běijīng jiàn guo tā.
examples.english: About two weeks ago I met with him in Beijing.

explanation: You can use 都 (dōu) to emphasize the large quantity of something, such as a group of people. The subject should be a large group (like '很多人', '大家') or refer to a recurring event (like '每天').

examples.chinese: 很 多 地方 都 有 WiFi。
examples.pinyin: Hěn duō dìfang dōu yǒu WiFi.
examples.english: A lot of places have WiFi.

examples.chinese: 我 的 很 多 朋友 都 有 车。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ de hěn duō péngyou dōu yǒu chē.
examples.english: A lot of my friends have cars.

examples.chinese: 很 多 美国人 都 喜欢 喝 咖啡 。
examples.pinyin: Hěn duō Měiguó rén dōu xǐhuan hē kāfēi.
examples.english: A lot of Americans like drinking coffee.

examples.chinese: 很 多 小孩 都 不 喜欢 上学。
examples.pinyin: Hěn duō xiǎohái dōu bù xǐhuan shàngxué.
examples.english: A lot of kids don't like to go to school.

examples.chinese: 很 多 女孩 都 想 找 有钱 的 男朋友。
examples.pinyin: Hěn duō nǚhái dōu xiǎng zhǎo yǒuqián de nánpéngyou.
examples.english: A lot of girls want to find a rich boyfriend.

examples.chinese: 大家 都 来 了 吗？
examples.pinyin: Dàjiā dōu lái le ma?
examples.english: Is everyone here?

examples.chinese: 大家 都 应该 知道。
examples.pinyin: Dàjiā dōu yīnggāi zhīdao.
examples.english: Everyone should know.

examples.chinese: 大家 都 说 你 很 聪明。
examples.pinyin: Dàjiā dōu shuō nǐ hěn cōngming.
examples.english: Everyone says you're smart.

examples.chinese: 大家 都 忘 了 他 的 名字。
examples.pinyin: Dàjiā dōu wàng le tā de míngzi.
examples.english: Everyone forgot his name.

examples.chinese: 大家 都 喜欢 吃辣 吗？
examples.pinyin: Dàjiā dōu xǐhuan chī là ma?
examples.english: Does everyone like eating spicy food?

examples.chinese: 我 每天 都 要 上班 。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ měi tiān dōu yào shàngbān.
examples.english: I have to go to work every day.

examples.chinese: 老师 每天 都 迟到。
examples.pinyin: Lǎoshī měi tiān dōu chídào.
examples.english: The teacher comes late every day.

examples.chinese: 她 每天 都 不 吃 早饭。
examples.pinyin: Tā měi tiān dōu bù chī zǎofàn.
examples.english: Every day, she does not eat breakfast.

examples.chinese: 我 女朋友 每天 都 上 淘宝 。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ nǚpéngyou měi tiān dōu shàng Táobǎo.
examples.english: My girlfriend goes on Taobao every day.

examples.chinese: 妈妈 每天 都 给 我们 做 晚饭。
examples.pinyin: Māma měi tiān dōu gěi wǒmen zuò wǎnfàn.
examples.english: Mom cooks dinner for us every day.

examples.chinese: 美国人 都 说 英文。
examples.pinyin: Měiguó rén dōu shuō Yīngwén.
examples.english: Americans all speak English.

examples.chinese: 我们 五 个 人 都 去。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen wǔ gè rén dōu qù.
examples.english: All five of us are going.

examples.chinese: 四川人 都 喜欢 吃辣。
examples.pinyin: Sìchuān rén dōu xǐhuan chī là.
examples.english: Sichuanese people all like eating spicy food.

examples.chinese: 我 的 家人 都 没 去 过 中国。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ de jiārén dōu méi qù guo Zhōngguó.
examples.english: None of my family members has been to China.

examples.chinese: 我 的 学生 都 喜欢 问 问题。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ de xuésheng dōu xǐhuan wèn wènti.
examples.english: My students all like to ask questions.

explanation: The adverb 一直 (yīzhí) can be used to express that you are doing something all along, have been continuously doing something since a certain time, or that something will continuously happen. It is frequently translated as 'always' in English.

examples.chinese: 我 一直 在 学习 中文 。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ yīzhí zài xuéxí Zhōngwén.
examples.english: I've been studying Chinese all along.

examples.chinese: 昨天 晚上 我 一直 在 做作业。
examples.pinyin: Zuótiān wǎnshang wǒ yīzhí zài zuò zuòyè.
examples.english: Yesterday evening I was continuously doing homework.

examples.chinese: 老板 一直 很 忙 。
examples.pinyin: Lǎobǎn yīzhí hěn máng.
examples.english: The boss is always very busy.

examples.chinese: 我 一直 很 喜欢 你。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ yīzhí hěn xǐhuan nǐ.
examples.english: I've always liked you a lot.

examples.chinese: 爸爸 一直 都 不 抽烟。
examples.pinyin: Bàba yīzhí dōu bù chōuyān.
examples.english: Dad has never smoked cigarettes.

examples.chinese: 我 男朋友 一直 在 中国 教 英文。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ nánpéngyou yīzhí zài Zhōngguó jiāo Yīngwén.
examples.english: My boyfriend has always been teaching English in China.

examples.chinese: 18 岁 以后 ， 他 一直 一个人 住。
examples.pinyin: Shíbā suì yǐhòu, tā yīzhí yīgèrén zhù.
examples.english: Since he was 18, he has always lived alone.

examples.chinese: 你 一直 在 这 家 公司 工作 吗？
examples.pinyin: Nǐ yīzhí zài zhè jiā gōngsī gōngzuò ma?
examples.english: Have you always worked in this company?

examples.chinese: 你们 一直 住 在 一起 吗？
examples.pinyin: Nǐmen yīzhí zhù zài yīqǐ ma?
examples.english: Have you always been living together?

examples.chinese: 北京 的 空气 一直 很 不 好。
examples.pinyin: Běijīng de kōngqì yīzhí hěn bù hǎo.
examples.english: The air in Beijing has been bad for a while.

structure: Positive: 已经 + Verb/Adjective/Time Noun + 了. Negative: 已经 + 不 + Verb Phrase + 了.
explanation: The pattern 已经...了 (yǐjīng... le) is used to express 'already'. The particle 了 at the end is important for natural-sounding Chinese. The negative form, 已经不...了, is usually translated as 'not... anymore'.

examples.chinese: 他们 已经 走 了 。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen yǐjīng zǒu le.
examples.english: They've already left.

examples.chinese: 我 已经 有 男朋友 了 。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ yǐjīng yǒu nánpéngyou le.
examples.english: I already have a boyfriend.

examples.chinese: 宝宝 已经 会 说话 了 。
examples.pinyin: Bǎobao yǐjīng huì shuōhuà le.
examples.english: The baby can already speak.

examples.chinese: 妈妈 已经 回来 了 。
examples.pinyin: Māma yǐjīng huílái le.
examples.english: Mom has already come back.

examples.chinese: 他 已经 上 飞机 了 。
examples.pinyin: Tā yǐjīng shàng fēijī le.
examples.english: He's already gotten on the plane.

examples.chinese: 爸爸 妈妈 已经 老 了 。
examples.pinyin: Bàba māma yǐjīng lǎo le.
examples.english: Mom and dad are already old.

examples.chinese: 已经 很 便宜 了 。
examples.pinyin: Yǐjīng hěn piányi le.
examples.english: It is already very cheap.

examples.chinese: 你女朋友 已经 很 漂亮 了 ！
examples.pinyin: Nǐ nǚpéngyou yǐjīng hěn piàoliang le!
examples.english: Your girlfriend is already very beautiful!

examples.chinese: 你 的 感冒 已经 好 了 吗 ？
examples.pinyin: Nǐ de gǎnmào yǐjīng hǎo le ma?
examples.english: Is your cold already better?

examples.chinese: 已经 很 晚 了 ，我们 走 吧。
examples.pinyin: Yǐjīng hěn wǎn le, wǒmen zǒu ba.
examples.english: It's already really late. Let's go.

examples.chinese: 已经 11点 了 ，女儿 还 没 回来 。
examples.pinyin: Yǐjīng shíyī diǎn le, nǚ'ér hái méi huílái.
examples.english: It is already 11 o'clock, and my daughter has not returned.

examples.chinese: 爷爷 已经 八十五 岁 了 。
examples.pinyin: Yéye yǐjīng bāshí-wǔ suì le.
examples.english: Grandpa is already eighty-five years old.

examples.chinese: 我 学习 中文 已经 一 年 了 。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xuéxí Zhōngwén yǐjīng yī nián le.
examples.english: I have already been studying Chinese for a year.

examples.chinese: 他 在 洗手间 里 已经 半 个 小时 了 。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài xǐshǒujiān lǐ yǐjīng bàn ge xiǎoshí le.
examples.english: He has already been in the bathroom for half an hour.

examples.chinese: 爸爸 去 北京 出差 已经 两 天 了 。
examples.pinyin: Bàba qù Běijīng chūchāi yǐjīng liǎng tiān le.
examples.english: It has already been two days since dad went to Beijing on business trip.

examples.chinese: 我 已经 不 喜欢 你 了 。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ yǐjīng bù xǐhuan nǐ le.
examples.english: I don't like you anymore.

examples.chinese: 他 已经 不 爱 他 的 猫 了 。
examples.pinyin: Tā yǐjīng bù ài tā de māo le.
examples.english: He doesn't love his cat anymore.

examples.chinese: 他们 已经 不 住 在 中国 了 。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen yǐjīng bù zhù zài Zhōngguó le.
examples.english: They don't live in China anymore.

examples.chinese: 我 已经 不 需要 父母 的 钱 了 。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ yǐjīng bù xūyào fùmǔ de qián le.
examples.english: I don't need my parents' money anymore.

examples.chinese: 你 已经 不 在 Google 工作 了 吗？
examples.pinyin: Nǐ yǐjīng bù zài Google gōngzuò le ma?
examples.english: You don't work at Google anymore?

structure: With verb: Subj. + 总是 + Verb. With adjective: 总是 + Modifier (e.g., 很, 这么) + Adj.
explanation: The adverb 总是 (zǒngshì) means 'always' and is used to describe a daily routine, a habit, or something that consistently happens. It comes before the verb. When used with an adjective, a modifier like 很, 这么, or 那么 is needed between 总是 and the adjective.

examples.chinese: 他 总是 迟到。
examples.pinyin: Tā zǒngshì chídào.
examples.english: He is always late.

examples.chinese: 我 总是 忘记 这 个 词。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zǒngshì wàngjì zhè ge cí.
examples.english: I always forget this word.

examples.chinese: 他 总是 一个人 吃 饭。
examples.pinyin: Tā zǒngshì yīgèrén chīfàn.
examples.english: He always eats alone.

examples.chinese: 你 男朋友 总是 说 脏话。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ nánpéngyou zǒngshì shuō zānghuà.
examples.english: Your boyfriend always uses foul language.

examples.chinese: 我 的 学生 总是 问 我 很多 有意思 的 问题。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ de xuésheng zǒngshì wèn wǒ hěn duō yǒuyìsi de wènti.
examples.english: My students always ask me lots of interesting questions.

examples.chinese: 他 总是 很 累。
examples.pinyin: Tā zǒngshì hěn lèi.
examples.english: He is always tired.

examples.chinese: 别 总是 不 高兴。
examples.pinyin: Bié zǒngshì bù gāoxìng.
examples.english: Don't always be unhappy.

examples.chinese: 你 为什么 总是 这么 忙？
examples.pinyin: Nǐ wèishénme zǒngshì zhème máng?
examples.english: Why are you always so busy?

examples.chinese: 他 做 事 总是 那么 慢。
examples.pinyin: Tā zuòshì zǒngshì nàme màn.
examples.english: He always does things so slow.

examples.chinese: 妈妈 睡觉 总是 那么 晚。
examples.pinyin: Māma shuìjiào zǒngshì nàme wǎn.
examples.english: Mom always goes to bed so late.

structure: Subj. + Verb + Obj. 1, 还 + Verb + Obj. 2
explanation: The adverb 还 (hái) can link two phrases to mean 'and also'. It's used when one subject performs two different actions or has two different attributes. This is different from 也 (yě), which is used when two different subjects perform the same action.

examples.chinese: 她 有 一 个 弟弟， 还 有 一 个 妹妹。
examples.pinyin: Tā yǒu yī gè dìdi, hái yǒu yī gè mèimei.
examples.english: She has a younger brother and also has a younger sister.

examples.chinese: 我 老板 会 说 法语， 还 会 说 日语。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ lǎobǎn huì shuō Fǎyǔ, hái huì shuō Rìyǔ.
examples.english: My boss can speak French and can also speak Japanese.

examples.chinese: 你 要 一 杯 咖啡， 还 要 什么？
examples.pinyin: Nǐ yào yī bēi kāfēi, hái yào shénme?
examples.english: You want a cup of coffee, and what else do you want?

examples.chinese: 我 想 吃 冰淇淋， 还 想 吃 汉堡。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xiǎng chī bīngqílín, hái xiǎng chī hànbǎo.
examples.english: I want to eat ice cream and I also want to eat a hamburger.

examples.chinese: 爸爸 有 一个 小米 手机， 还 有 一个 iPhone。
examples.pinyin: Bàba yǒu yī gè Xiǎomǐ shǒujī, hái yǒu yī gè iPhone.
examples.english: Dad has a Xiaomi phone and also has an iPhone.

examples.chinese: 你 晚上 在家 做 了 作业， 还 做 了 什么？
examples.pinyin: Nǐ wǎnshang zài jiā zuò le zuòyè, hái zuò le shénme?
examples.english: You did your homework at home tonight, and what else did you do?

examples.chinese: 他 结婚 的 时候，请 了 同事， 还 请 了 谁？
examples.pinyin: Tā jiéhūn de shíhou, qǐng le tóngshì, hái qǐng le shéi.
examples.english: When he got married, he invited his co-workers. Who else did he invite?

examples.chinese: 生日 的 时候，我们 会 吃 蛋糕， 还 要 送 礼物。
examples.pinyin: Shēngrì de shíhou, wǒmen huì chī dàngāo, hái yào sòng lǐwù.
examples.english: During a birthday, we eat cake and also give presents.

examples.chinese: 去 美国 要 带 钱、护照， 还 要 带 什么？
examples.pinyin: Qù Měiguó yào dài qián, hùzhào, hái yào dài shénme?
examples.english: To go to America, you need to take money and a passport. What else do you need to take with you?

examples.chinese: 我 上 大学 的 时候 认识 了 很 多 好 朋友， 还 认识 了 我 现在 的 女朋友。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ shàng dàxué de shíhou rènshi le hěn duō hǎo péngyou, hái rènshi le wǒ xiànzài de nǚpéngyou.
examples.english: When I was in college, I met many good friends and also my current girlfriend.

structure: 更 + Adj. OR A + 比 + B + 更 + Adj.
explanation: 更 (gèng) is used to express 'even more' and generally comes before adjectives. It's not just a way to make a comparative, but rather to add 'even more' to an already existing quality. It can be used with 比 (bǐ) to express that 'A is even more Adj. than B.'

examples.chinese: 这 两个 银行 哪 个 更 近 ？
examples.pinyin: Zhè liǎng gè yínháng nǎ ge gèng jìn?
examples.english: Between these two banks, which one is closer?

examples.chinese: 我 想 找 一 个 更 有钱 的 男朋友。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xiǎng zhǎo yī gè gèng yǒuqián de nánpéngyou.
examples.english: I want to find a richer boyfriend.

examples.chinese: 我 喜欢 在 网上 买书，因为 更 便宜。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xǐhuan zài wǎngshàng mǎi shū, yīnwèi gèng piányi.
examples.english: I like buying books online because it's cheaper.

examples.chinese: 不要 太 高兴，我们 还 有 更 多 的 工作 要 做。
examples.pinyin: Bùyào tài gāoxìng, wǒmen hái yǒu gèng duō de gōngzuò yào zuò.
examples.english: Don't get too excited. We still have more work to do.

examples.chinese: 结婚 以后， 她 变 得 更 漂亮 了。
examples.pinyin: Jiéhūn yǐhòu, tā biàn de gèng piàoliang le.
examples.english: She's become more beautiful after she got married.

examples.chinese: 北京 的 房子 比 上海 更 贵。
examples.pinyin: Běijīng de fángzi bǐ Shànghǎi gèng guì.
examples.english: The houses in Beijing are even more expensive than in Shanghai.

structure: Noun 1 + 比 + Noun 2 + 更 + Adj.
explanation: This structure uses '更' (gèng) in combination with '比' (bǐ) to make a comparison and emphasize that the difference is significant, translating to 'even more... than...'.

examples.chinese: 春节比中秋节更热闹。
examples.pinyin: Chūnjié bǐ Zhōngqiūjié gèng rènao.
examples.english: Spring Festival is even more boisterous than Mid-autumn Festival.

examples.chinese: 汉字比声调更难。
examples.pinyin: Hànzì bǐ shēngdiào gèng nán.
examples.english: Chinese characters are even more difficult than tones.

examples.chinese: 他现在的女朋友比以前的更漂亮。
examples.pinyin: Tā xiànzài de nǚpéngyou bǐ yǐqián de gèng piàoliang.
examples.english: His current girlfriend is even more beautiful than his previous one.

examples.chinese: 中国的高铁比飞机更方便。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngguó de gāotiě bǐ fēijī gèng fāngbiàn.
examples.english: China's high-speed trains are even more convenient than airplanes.

structure: Subj. + 刚 / 刚刚 + Verb OR Subj. + 刚 + Verb (+ Obj.) + Duration
explanation: 刚 (gāng) or 刚刚 (gānggāng) is used to express an action that happened not long ago, equivalent to 'just' in English. It can also be used with a duration to specify how long ago the action happened, without needing a separate word for 'ago'.

examples.chinese: 我们刚知道。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen gāng zhīdao.
examples.english: We just found out.

examples.chinese: 她们刚走。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen gāng zǒu.
examples.english: They just left.

examples.chinese: 老板刚刚到办公室。
examples.pinyin: Lǎobǎn gānggāng dào bàngōngshì.
examples.english: The boss just arrived at the office.

examples.chinese: 我老婆刚生完孩子。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ lǎopo gāng shēng wán háizi.
examples.english: My wife just finished giving birth to our baby.

examples.chinese: 你刚刚下班吗？
examples.pinyin: Nǐ gānggāng xiàbān ma?
examples.english: Did you just get off work?

examples.chinese: 我刚认识她十天。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ gāng rènshi tā shí tiān.
examples.english: We just met each other ten days ago.

examples.chinese: 他刚来中国两个月。
examples.pinyin: Tā gāng lái Zhōngguó liǎng gè yuè.
examples.english: He just got to China two months ago.

examples.chinese: 我弟弟刚工作半年。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ dìdi gāng gōngzuò bàn nián.
examples.english: My younger brother just started working half a year ago.

examples.chinese: 她刚结婚三个月。
examples.pinyin: Tā gāng jiéhūn sān gè yuè.
examples.english: She just got married three months ago.

examples.chinese: 我的车刚买两天，开的时候小心点。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ de chē gāng mǎi liǎng tiān, kāi de shíhou xiǎoxīn diǎn.
examples.english: I just bought the car two days ago. Be careful when you drive.

structure: 只 + Verb OR 只 + Aux. Verb (+ Verb)
explanation: 只 (zhǐ) is the most basic adverb to express 'only'. It is normally placed before a verb or an auxiliary verb like 会 (huì) or 能 (néng).

examples.chinese: 我只有一个哥哥。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zhǐ yǒu yī gè gēge.
examples.english: I only have one older brother.

examples.chinese: 我们只有十块钱。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen zhǐ yǒu shí kuài qián.
examples.english: We only have ten RMB.

examples.chinese: 我们公司只有两个员工。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen gōngsī zhǐ yǒu liǎng gè yuángōng.
examples.english: Our company only has two employees.

examples.chinese: 你只爱吃肉吗？
examples.pinyin: Nǐ zhǐ ài chī ròu ma?
examples.english: Do you only like eating meat?

examples.chinese: 他们只会说英文。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen zhǐ huì shuō Yīngwén.
examples.english: They can only speak English.

examples.chinese: 我只能说两句中文。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zhǐ néng shuō liǎng jù Zhōngwén.
examples.english: I can only say two sentences in Chinese.

examples.chinese: 你们只要咖啡吗？
examples.pinyin: Nǐmen zhǐ yào kāfēi ma?
examples.english: Do you only want coffee?

examples.chinese: 我老婆只要一个孩子。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ lǎopo zhǐ yào yī gè háizi.
examples.english: My wife only wants one child.

examples.chinese: 宝宝只会走，不会跑。
examples.pinyin: Bǎobao zhǐ huì zǒu, bù huì pǎo.
examples.english: The baby can only walk. He can't run.

examples.chinese: 我只想跟你在一起。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zhǐ xiǎng gēn nǐ zài yīqǐ.
examples.english: I only want to be with you.

structure: Subj. + 在 + Verb + Obj. OR Subj. + 正在 + Verb + Obj.
explanation: 在 (zài) and 正在 (zhèngzài) are used as auxiliary verbs to express that an action is ongoing or in progress, similar to the present continuous in English. 正在 (zhèngzài) is used to put more emphasis on an action that is in progress right now (or at a specific moment in the past).

examples.chinese: 她在看书。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài kànshū.
examples.english: She is reading.

examples.chinese: 妈妈在打电话。
examples.pinyin: Māma zài dǎ diànhuà.
examples.english: Mom is making a phone call.

examples.chinese: 谁在里面洗澡？
examples.pinyin: Sheí zài lǐmiàn xǐzǎo?
examples.english: Who is taking a shower in there?

examples.chinese: 阿姨正在打扫我们的房间。
examples.pinyin: Āyí zhèngzài dǎsǎo wǒmen de fángjiān.
examples.english: The cleaning lady is cleaning our room right now.

examples.chinese: 昨天晚上七点，我们在吃饭。
examples.pinyin: Zuótiān wǎnshang qīdiǎn, wǒmen zài chīfàn.
examples.english: Yesterday at 7pm, we were eating dinner.

examples.chinese: 老板在开会，没有时间见你。
examples.pinyin: Lǎobǎn zài kāihuì, méiyǒu shíjiān jiàn nǐ.
examples.english: The boss is currently in a meeting. He doesn't have time to see you.

examples.chinese: 我现在在上班，不方便离开。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xiànzài zài shàngbān, bù fāngbiàn líkāi.
examples.english: I am working now. It's not convenient for me to leave.

examples.chinese: 我们正在上课，请你等一会儿。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen zhèngzài shàngkè, qǐng nǐ děng yīhuìr.
examples.english: We are in class right now; please wait a moment.

examples.chinese: 你正在开车，不可以玩手机。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ zhèngzài kāichē, bù kěyǐ wán shǒujī.
examples.english: You're driving right now; you can't play with your cell phone.

examples.chinese: 你给我打电话的时候，我正在跟朋友喝酒。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ gěi wǒ dǎ diànhuà de shíhou, wǒ zhèngzài gēn péngyou hējiǔ.
examples.english: When you called me, I was drinking with friends.

explanation: 别 (bié) is used to form negative commands, meaning 'don't'. It's considered a quicker and more forceful way to give a negative command than 不要 (bùyào), and can be thought of as a contraction of it.

examples.chinese: 别走。
examples.pinyin: Bié zǒu.
examples.english: Don't leave.

examples.chinese: 别说话！
examples.pinyin: Bié shuōhuà!
examples.english: Don't speak!

examples.chinese: 别笑！
examples.pinyin: Bié xiào!
examples.english: Don't laugh!

examples.chinese: 别动！
examples.pinyin: Bié dòng!
examples.english: Don't move!

examples.chinese: 别过来！
examples.pinyin: Bié guòlái!
examples.english: Don't come over here!

examples.chinese: 别打孩子！
examples.pinyin: Bié dǎ háizi!
examples.english: Don't hit the child!

examples.chinese: 别喝太多。
examples.pinyin: Bié hē tài duō.
examples.english: Don't drink too much.

examples.chinese: 喝酒以后别开车。
examples.pinyin: Hējiǔ yǐhòu bié kāichē.
examples.english: After drinking alcohol, don't drive.

examples.chinese: 吃饭的时候别玩手机。
examples.pinyin: Chīfàn de shíhou bié wán shǒujī.
examples.english: When eating, don't play with your cell phone.

examples.chinese: 上课的时候别说英文。
examples.pinyin: Shàngkè de shíhou bié shuō Yīngwén.
examples.english: Don't speak English in class.

structure: Subj. + 一边 + Verb, + 一边 + Verb
explanation: To express that one thing is done while doing something else, the word 一边 (yībiān) is used. Both actions must be intentional and actively performed. 一边 (yībiān) can sometimes be shortened to 边 (biān) for a less formal feel. The 'main' action usually comes first in the Chinese sentence structure.

examples.chinese: 不要一边吃东西，一边说话。
examples.pinyin: Bù yào yībiān chī dōngxi, yībiān shuōhuà.
examples.english: Don't eat while speaking.

examples.chinese: 我常常一边洗澡，一边唱歌。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ chángcháng yībiān xǐzǎo, yībiān chànggē.
examples.english: I often sing while I take a shower.

examples.chinese: 小孩子喜欢一边吃饭，一边玩。
examples.pinyin: Xiǎoháizi xǐhuan yībiān chīfàn, yībiān wán.
examples.english: Children like to eat while playing.

examples.chinese: 你喜欢一边听音乐，一边做作业吗？
examples.pinyin: Nǐ xǐhuan yībiān tīng yīnyuè, yībiān zuò zuòyè ma?
examples.english: Do you like to listen to music while doing homework?

examples.chinese: 我们一边走一边聊吧。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen yībiān zǒu yībiān liáo ba.
examples.english: Let's walk while we talk.

examples.chinese: 请你一边读一边写。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng nǐ yībiān dú yībiān xiě.
examples.english: Please write as you read.

examples.chinese: 不要一边开车，一边打电话。
examples.pinyin: Bù yào yībiān kāichē, yībiān dǎ diànhuà.
examples.english: Don't talk on the phone while you drive.

examples.chinese: 老板喜欢一边抽烟，一边工作。
examples.pinyin: Lǎobǎn xǐhuan yībiān chōuyān, yībiān gōngzuò.
examples.english: The boss likes to smoke while working.

examples.chinese: 很多人都一边上班，一边玩手机。
examples.pinyin: Hěn duō rén dōu yībiān shàngbān, yībiān wán shǒujī.
examples.english: Many people play with their cell phone while working.

examples.chinese: 她老公很忙，她常常一边做饭，一边带小孩。
examples.pinyin: Tā lǎogōng hěn máng, tā chángcháng yībiān zuò fàn, yībiān dài xiǎohái.
examples.english: Her husband is very busy. She often looks after the baby while cooking food.

explanation: 多 (duō) is used to ask questions about the degree or extent of an adjective, translating to 'How [adjective]...?' For example, it can be used to ask 'how tall?', 'how big?', or 'how old?'. When asking about age, '你多大?' (nǐ duōdà) is informal and typically used for friends or children.

examples.chinese: 她多高？
examples.pinyin: Tā duō gāo?
examples.english: How tall is she?

examples.chinese: 你家多大？
examples.pinyin: Nǐ jiā duō dà?
examples.english: How large is your house?

examples.chinese: 你的小孩多大？
examples.pinyin: Nǐ de xiǎohái duō dà?
examples.english: How old is your child?

examples.chinese: 黄河多长？
examples.pinyin: Huánghé duō cháng?
examples.english: How long is the Yellow River?

examples.chinese: 你家离这儿多远？
examples.pinyin: Nǐ jiā lí zhèr duō yuǎn?
examples.english: How far is your house away from here?

examples.chinese: 你要在美国待多久？
examples.pinyin: Nǐ yào zài Měiguó dāi duō jiǔ?
examples.english: How long are you going to stay in America?

examples.chinese: 这些东西多重？
examples.pinyin: Zhè xiē dōngxi duō zhòng?
examples.english: How heavy are these things?

examples.chinese: 你知道她现在多胖吗？
examples.pinyin: Nǐ zhīdao tā xiànzài duō pàng ma?
examples.english: Do you know how fat she is now?

examples.chinese: 你知道这里的冬天多冷吗？
examples.pinyin: Nǐ zhīdao zhèlǐ de dōngtiān duō lěng ma?
examples.english: Do you know how cold it is here in winter?

examples.chinese: 你知道上海的房子多贵吗？
examples.pinyin: Nǐ zhīdao Shànghǎi de fángzi duō guì ma?
examples.english: Do you know how expensive housing is in Shanghai?

structure: Noun 1 + 跟/和 + Noun 2 + 一样 (+ Adj.)
explanation: 一样 (yīyàng) is used to express that two things are the same. It can be used alone to state that two things are alike, or with an adjective to specify that they share a quality to the same degree (e.g., 'as tall as').

examples.chinese: 我和你一样。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ hé nǐ yīyàng.
examples.english: I am the same as you.

examples.chinese: 他的性格跟他妈妈一样。
examples.pinyin: Tā de xìnggé gēn tā māma yīyàng.
examples.english: He has the same personality as his mom.

examples.chinese: 北京的天气和上海不一样。
examples.pinyin: Běijīng de tiānqì hé Shànghǎi bù yīyàng.
examples.english: The weather in Beijing and the weather in Shanghai are not alike.

examples.chinese: 这个词的意思和那个词一样吗？
examples.pinyin: Zhè ge cí de yìsi hé nà ge cí yīyàng ma?
examples.english: Is the meaning of this word and that word the same?

examples.chinese: 美国文化跟中国文化不一样。
examples.pinyin: Měiguó wénhuà gēn Zhōngguó wénhuà bù yīyàng.
examples.english: America culture and Chinese culture are not alike.

examples.chinese: 啤酒和葡萄酒的味道一样吗？
examples.pinyin: Píjiǔ hé pútaojiǔ de wèidao yīyàng ma?
examples.english: Do beer and red wine taste the same?

examples.chinese: 你家跟我家一样大。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ jiā gēn wǒ jiā yīyàng dà.
examples.english: Your house is just as big as mine.

examples.chinese: 她和她哥哥一样高。
examples.pinyin: Tā hé tā gēge yīyàng gāo.
examples.english: She and her older brother are equally tall.

examples.chinese: 你的头发和我的头发一样长。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ de tóufa hé wǒ de tóufa yīyàng cháng.
examples.english: You hair is as long as mine.

examples.chinese: 这里的天气跟我老家一样舒服。
examples.pinyin: Zhèlǐ de tiānqì gēn wǒ lǎojiā yīyàng shūfu.
examples.english: The weather here is just as comfortable as my hometown's.

examples.chinese: 你跟老板一样忙吗？
examples.pinyin: Nǐ gēn lǎobǎn yīyàng máng ma?
examples.english: Are you as busy as the boss is?

structure: Subj. + 有点(儿) / 有一点(儿) + Adj.
explanation: 有点 (yǒudiǎn) or 有一点 (yǒu yīdiǎn) is used to say that something is 'a little too' or 'a bit too' much of a certain quality. It often carries a negative or unpleasant connotation for the speaker, expressing slight dissatisfaction or discomfort. In spoken Chinese, the 一 (yī) is often dropped. It is not used with positive adjectives like 'happy' or 'fun'.

examples.chinese: 我有一点饿。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ yǒu yīdiǎn è.
examples.english: I'm a little hungry.

examples.chinese: 这个菜有一点辣。
examples.pinyin: Zhè ge cài yǒu yīdiǎn là.
examples.english: This dish is a little too spicy.

examples.chinese: 昨天有一点热。
examples.pinyin: Zuótiān yǒu yīdiǎn rè.
examples.english: Yesterday it was a little too hot.

examples.chinese: 上海的冬天有一点冷。
examples.pinyin: Shànghǎi de dōngtiān yǒu yīdiǎn lěng.
examples.english: Winter in Shanghai is a bit too cold.

examples.chinese: 我弟弟有点胖。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ dìdi yǒudiǎn pàng.
examples.english: My younger brother is a bit fat.

examples.chinese: 今天有点累。
examples.pinyin: Jīntiān yǒudiǎn lèi.
examples.english: Today I am a little bit tired.

examples.chinese: 这个月公司有点忙。
examples.pinyin: Zhè ge yuè gōngsī yǒudiǎn máng.
examples.english: This month the company is a little bit busy.

examples.chinese: 这个地方有点吵，我们走吧。
examples.pinyin: Zhè ge dìfang yǒudiǎn chǎo, wǒmen zǒu ba.
examples.english: This place is a little too noisy. Let's go.

examples.chinese: 爸爸回来有点晚，妈妈有点不高兴。
examples.pinyin: Bàba huílái yǒudiǎn wǎn, māma yǒudiǎn bù gāoxìng.
examples.english: Dad came back home a bit too late, so mom was a little unhappy.

examples.chinese: 老师今天有点不舒服，所以没来上课。
examples.pinyin: Lǎoshī jīntiān yǒudiǎn bù shūfu, suǒyǐ méi lái shàngkè.
examples.english: Today, the teacher felt a little unwell, so she didn't come to class.

structure: Subj. + 又 + Adj. 1 + 又 + Adj. 2
explanation: The character 又 (yòu) can be used to give two qualities to something. Using the double 又 (yòu) structure is like saying that something is "both... and... " in English. The two words shouldn't contrast in feeling. It is important to note they must both be bad or both be good.

examples.chinese: 她 男朋友 又 高 又 帅。
examples.pinyin: Tā nánpéngyou yòu gāo yòu shuài.
examples.english: Her boyfriend is both tall and handsome.

examples.chinese: 这 个 房子 又 大 又 亮。
examples.pinyin: Zhè ge fángzi yòu dà yòu liàng.
examples.english: This house is both big and bright.

examples.chinese: 妈妈 的 头发 又 黑 又 亮。
examples.pinyin: Māma de tóufa yòu hēi yòu liàng.
examples.english: Mom's hair is both black and shiny.

examples.chinese: 我姐姐 又 聪明 又 漂亮。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ jiějie yòu cōngming yòu piàoliang.
examples.english: My older sister is both smart and beautiful.

examples.chinese: 中国菜 又 便宜 又 好吃。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngguócài yòu piányi yòu hǎochī.
examples.english: Chinese food is both cheap and good-tasting.

examples.chinese: 你们 老板 又 年轻 又 有钱。
examples.pinyin: Nǐmen lǎobǎn yòu niánqīng yòu yǒu qián.
examples.english: Your boss is both young and rich.

examples.chinese: 这里 的 咖啡 又 贵 又 难喝。
examples.pinyin: Zhèlǐ de kāfēi yòu guì yòu nánhē.
examples.english: The coffee here is both expensive and bad-tasting.

examples.chinese: 我家 小狗 又 可爱 又 听话。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ jiā xiǎogǒu yòu kě'ài yòu tīnghuà.
examples.english: My family's dog is both cute and obedient.

examples.chinese: 上海 的 冬天 又 冷 又 湿。
examples.pinyin: Shànghǎi de dōngtiān yòu lěng yòu shī.
examples.english: Winter here in Shanghai is both cold and humid.

examples.chinese: 她 小时候 又 矮 又 瘦。
examples.pinyin: Tā xiǎoshíhou yòu ǎi yòu shòu.
examples.english: She was both short and thin when she was young.

explanation: 不太 (bù tài) means "not very" or "not so" (literally "not too"). Note that this pattern does not normally use 了 (le). This pattern can be used with adjectives and some psychological verbs (e.g. 喜欢 (xǐhuan), 想 (xiǎng), 明白 (míngbai)).

examples.chinese: 我 家 不 太 大。
examples.pinyin: Wǒjiā bù tài dà.
examples.english: My house is not too big.

examples.chinese: 那 个 地方 不 太 远。
examples.pinyin: Nà ge dìfang bù tài yuǎn.
examples.english: That place is not very far away.

examples.chinese: 老板 今天 不 太 高兴。
examples.pinyin: Lǎobǎn jīntiān bù tài gāoxìng.
examples.english: The boss is not very happy today.

examples.chinese: 这 个 店 的 衣服 不 太 贵。
examples.pinyin: Zhè ge diàn de yīfu bù tài guì.
examples.english: The clothes in this shop are not too expensive.

examples.chinese: 我 觉得 他 不 太 聪明。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ juéde tā bù tài cōngming.
examples.english: I think he is not too smart.

examples.chinese: 我 不 太 懂。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ bù tài dǒng.
examples.english: I don't really understand.

examples.chinese: 他们 不 太 想 去。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen bù tài xiǎng qù.
examples.english: They don't really want to go.

examples.chinese: 我哥哥 不 太 喜欢 他 的 工作。
examples.pinyin: Wǒgēge bù tài xǐhuan tā de gōngzuò.
examples.english: My older brother doesn't really like his job.

examples.chinese: 他 不 太 明白 老板 的 意思。
examples.pinyin: Tā bù tài míngbai lǎobǎn de yìsi.
examples.english: He didn't really understand what the boss meant.

examples.chinese: 我 觉得 你 不 太 了解 我们 公司。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ juéde nǐ bù tài liǎojiě wǒmen gōngsī.
examples.english: I think that you don't really understand our company.

structure: Place 1 + 离 + Place 2 + Adv. + 近 / 远
explanation: One of the ways to express distance is to use 离 (lí). You'll normally want to pair 离 (lí) with the adjective 近 (jìn) for "close," or 远 (yuǎn) for "far." This pattern is normally used to simply express that one place is (not) close or (not) far from another place.

examples.chinese: 我 家 离 公司 很 近。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ jiā lí gōngsī hěn jìn.
examples.english: My house is close to my office.

examples.chinese: 美国 离 中国 很 远。
examples.pinyin: Měiguó lí Zhōngguó hěn yuǎn.
examples.english: The USA is far from China.

examples.chinese: 我老家 离 北京 很 远。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ lǎojiā lí Běijīng hěn yuǎn.
examples.english: My hometown is very far away from Beijing.

examples.chinese: 你家 离 超市 远 吗？
examples.pinyin: Nǐ jiā lí chāoshì yuǎn ma?
examples.english: Is your house far away from the supermarket?

examples.chinese: 你们 公司 离 地铁站 近 不 近？
examples.pinyin: Nǐmen gōngsī lí dìtiězhàn jìn bù jìn?
examples.english: Is your company close to the metro station?

examples.chinese: 你 的 大学 离 你 老家 远 不 远？
examples.pinyin: Nǐ de dàxué lí nǐ lǎojiā yuǎn bù yuǎn?
examples.english: Is your college far away from your hometown?

examples.chinese: 那 个 酒吧 离 这儿 太 远 了， 我 不 想 去。
examples.pinyin: Nà ge jiǔbā lí zhèr tài yuǎn le, wǒ bù xiǎng qù.
examples.english: That bar is too far away from here. I don't want to go.

examples.chinese: 这 个 酒店 离 火车站 很 近。
examples.pinyin: Zhè ge jiǔdiàn lí huǒchēzhàn hěn jìn.
examples.english: This hotel is very close to the train station.

examples.chinese: 我 不想 去 离 家 很远 的 地方 工作。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ bù xiǎng qù lí jiā hěn yuǎn de dìfang gōngzuò.
examples.english: I don't want to go work at a place very far away from home.

examples.chinese: 你 离 我 远 点 儿 ！
examples.pinyin: Nǐ lí wǒ yuǎn diǎnr!
examples.english: Distance yourself from me further.

explanation: One way to intensify a sentence is to make it an exclamation. To do this, you can use 多 (duō). 多 (duō) is used only for excited exclamations, whereas 很 (hěn) can be used in non-exclamatory sentences.

examples.chinese: 一个人 多 好！
examples.pinyin: Yīgèrén duō hǎo!
examples.english: It's so nice being alone!

examples.chinese: 你女儿 多 聪明 啊！
examples.pinyin: Nǐ nǚér duō cōngming a!
examples.english: Your daughter is so smart!

examples.chinese: 今天 天气 多 舒服 ！
examples.pinyin: Jīntiān tiānqì duō shūfu!
examples.english: Today's weather is so nice!

examples.chinese: 你 看 这 个 地方 ， 多 美 啊！
examples.pinyin: Nǐ kàn zhè ge dìfang, duō měi a!
examples.english: Look at this place, it is so beautiful!

examples.chinese: 学 中文 多 有 意思 啊！
examples.pinyin: Xué Zhōngwén duō yǒu yìsi a!
examples.english: Studying Chinese is so interesting!

examples.chinese: 坐 地铁 多 方便！
examples.pinyin: Zuò dìtiě duō fāngbiàn!
examples.english: How convenient it is to take the metro!

examples.chinese: 你 看 这 个 小狗， 多 可爱！
examples.pinyin: Nǐ kàn zhè ge xiǎogǒu, duō kěài!
examples.english: Look at this puppy! It is so cute!

examples.chinese: 他们 每天 工作 十 二 个 小时 ， 多 累 啊！
examples.pinyin: Tāmen měitiān gōngzuò shí èr gè xiǎoshí, duō lèi a!
examples.english: They work twelve hours every day, they must be so tired!

examples.chinese: 这样做 多 麻烦！
examples.pinyin: Zhè yàng zuò duō máfan!
examples.english: Doing it this way is so troublesome!

examples.chinese: 这些菜 多 好吃 啊！
examples.pinyin: Zhè xiē cài duō hǎochī a!
examples.english: These foods are so delicious!

examples.chinese: 你 男朋友 多 帅 啊！
examples.pinyin: Nǐ nánpéngyou duō shuài a!
examples.english: Your boyfriend is so handsome!

structure: Subj. + 还 + 好 / 可以 / 行 / 不错
explanation: Whenever you want to imply that something is "good," but also kind of "meh," you can use 还 (hái) in front of the "good" adjective. Besides expressing continuation, 还 (hái) can also be used to weaken positive adjectives. This is similar to saying "fairly [good]" or "reasonably [good]" in English. It's also sometimes used by a speaker to be more modest.

examples.chinese: 我 还 好 。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ hái hǎo.
examples.english: I'm OK.

examples.chinese: 爸爸 做 的 菜 还 可以 。
examples.pinyin: Bàba zuò de cài hái kěyǐ.
examples.english: The food that dad cooks is OK.

examples.chinese: 我们 老板 还 不错 。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen lǎobǎn hái bùcuò.
examples.english: Our boss is not too bad.

examples.chinese: 这 家 店 还 行 ，不太 贵。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jià diàn hái xíng, bù tài guì.
examples.english: This shop is OK. It's not too expensive.

examples.chinese: 我 男朋友 的 收入 还 可以 。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ nánpéngyou de shōurù hái kěyǐ.
examples.english: My boyfriend's salary is OK.

examples.chinese: 新的 办公室 还 不错 。
examples.pinyin: Xīn de bàngōngshì hái bùcuò.
examples.english: The new office is OK.

examples.chinese: 我 觉得 这里 的 菜 还 可以 ，没有 那么 难吃。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ juéde zhèlǐ de cài hái kěyǐ, méiyǒu nàme nánchī.
examples.english: I think the food here is OK, it is not too bad-tasting.

examples.chinese: 这 个 牌子 还 不错 ，很 多 年轻人 喜欢。
examples.pinyin: Zhè ge páizi hái bùcuò, hěn duō niánqīngrén xǐhuan.
examples.english: This brand is not too bad. Many young people like it.

examples.chinese: 房子 还 可以 ，但是 有 点 贵。
examples.pinyin: Fángzi hái kěyǐ, dànshì yǒu diǎn guì.
examples.english: The apartment is not too bad, but it is a bit expensive.

examples.chinese: 这 个 人 身高 还 行 ，可是 有点 胖。
examples.pinyin: Zhège rén shēngāo hái xíng, kěshì yǒudiǎn pàng.
examples.english: This guy's height is OK, but he's a little fat.

explanation: By using 的 (de), we can connect descriptive adjectives to nouns. If the adjective has two characters (e.g. 漂亮 (piàoliang) or 高兴 (gāoxìng)), the 的 (de) is generally required. In some cases, it is possible to drop the noun from the pattern, and just use the adjective + 的 (de). This is kind of like saying "the big one" or "the red one" in English. The other person must be clear which "one" you're referring to.

examples.chinese: 漂亮 的 女孩儿
examples.pinyin: piàoliang de nǚháir
examples.english: beautiful girl

examples.chinese: 辣 的 菜
examples.pinyin: là de cài
examples.english: spicy food

examples.chinese: 可爱 的 宝宝
examples.pinyin: kě'ài de bǎobao
examples.english: a cute baby

examples.chinese: 我 喜欢 新鲜 的 果汁 。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xǐhuan xīnxiān de guǒzhī.
examples.english: I like fresh fruit juice.

examples.chinese: 他 常常 买 便宜 的 东西。
examples.pinyin: Tā chángcháng mǎi piányi de dōngxi.
examples.english: He often buys cheap stuff.

examples.chinese: A: 小孩儿 喜欢 吃 什么 东西 ？ B: 甜 的 。
examples.pinyin: A: Xiǎoháir xǐhuan chī shénme dōngxi? B: Tián de.
examples.english: A: What food do children like to eat? B: Sweet food.

examples.chinese: A: 你 喜欢 哪 种 女孩？ B: 漂亮 的 。
examples.pinyin: A: Nǐ xǐhuan nǎ zhǒng nǚhái? B: Piàoliang de.
examples.english: A: What kind of girls do you like? B: Pretty ones.

examples.chinese: A: 你 要 喝 冷 水 还是 热 水？ B: 冷 的 。
examples.pinyin: A: Nǐ xǐhuan hē lěng shuǐ háishì rè shuǐ? B: Lěng de.
examples.english: A: Do you want to drink cold or hot water? B: Cold.

examples.chinese: A: 你想 找 什么样 的 男朋友？ B: 有钱 的 。
examples.pinyin: A: Nǐ xiǎng zhǎo shénmeyàng de nánpéngyou? B: Yǒuqián de.
examples.english: A: What kind of boyfriend do you want to find? B: A rich one.

examples.chinese: A: 你 不 喜欢 吃 什么 菜？ B: 辣 的 。
examples.pinyin: A: Nǐ bù xǐhuan chī shénme cài? B: Là de.
examples.english: A: Which foods do you not like to eat? B: Spicy ones.

explanation: In addition to linking adjectives to nouns, 的 (de) can also be used to link a whole phrase to a noun, making the already useful 的 (de) even more useful. In English this is often achieved with "who" or "that." Here a phrase means Verb + (Object).

examples.chinese: 妈妈 做 的 菜
examples.pinyin: māma zuò de cài
examples.english: the food that mom cooks

examples.chinese: 去 北京 的 火车
examples.pinyin: qù Běijīng de huǒchē
examples.english: the train that goes to Beijing

examples.chinese: 你 教 的 学生
examples.pinyin: nǐ jiāo de xuésheng
examples.english: the students that you teach

examples.chinese: 老板 请 的 朋友
examples.pinyin: lǎobǎn qǐng de péngyou
examples.english: the friends that the boss invited

examples.chinese: 我 画 的 画
examples.pinyin: wǒ huà de huà
examples.english: the pictures that I draw

examples.chinese: 他 写 的 书
examples.pinyin: tā xiě de shū
examples.english: the books that he wrote

examples.chinese: 妈妈 给 我 买 的 衣服
examples.pinyin: māma gěi wǒ mǎi de yīfu
examples.english: the clothes that mom bought for me

examples.chinese: 客户 问 的 问题
examples.pinyin: kèhù wèn de wènti
examples.english: the questions that the client asked

examples.chinese: 穿 Prada 的 女人
examples.pinyin: chuān Prada de nǚrén
examples.english: women who wear Prada

examples.chinese: 不 喜欢 中国菜 的 老外
examples.pinyin: bù xǐhuan Zhōngguó cài de lǎowài
examples.english: the foreigners that don't like Chinese food

structure: 最 + Adj. / Psychological Verb (+ 了)
explanation: The most common way to form a superlative (best, worst, biggest, smallest, etc.) in Chinese is to use 最 (zuì) before an adjective (and a few select verbs). A 了 (le) is occasionally added after the adjective for emphasis. 最 (zuì) can also come before psychological verbs, to express what one "most likes," "most hates," etc. It won't make sense if you try to use 最 (zuì) with non-psychological verbs.

examples.chinese: 哪 个 老师 最 好？
examples.pinyin: Nǎ ge lǎoshī zuì hǎo?
examples.english: Which teacher is the best?

examples.chinese: 你们 家 谁 最 漂亮？
examples.pinyin: Nǐmen jiā shéi zuì piàoliang?
examples.english: In your family who is the most beautiful?

examples.chinese: Zuckerberg 最 有钱。
examples.pinyin: Zuckerberg zuì yǒuqián.
examples.english: Zuckerberg is the richest.

examples.chinese: 汉语 最 难。
examples.pinyin: Hànyǔ zuì nán.
examples.english: The Chinese language is the most difficult.

examples.chinese: 这 种 事 最 麻烦。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zhǒng shì zuì máfan.
examples.english: These kind of things are the most troublesome.

examples.chinese: 小狗 最 可爱 了 。
examples.pinyin: Xiǎogǒu zuì kěài le.
examples.english: The puppy is the cutest.

examples.chinese: 四川菜 最 辣 了 。
examples.pinyin: Sìchuān cài zuì là le.
examples.english: Sichuan food is the spiciest.

examples.chinese: 我 的 中国 朋友 最 热情 了 。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ de Zhōngguó péngyou zuì rèqíng le.
examples.english: My Chinese friend is the most enthusiastic.

examples.chinese: 他 的 学生 最 认真 了 。
examples.pinyin: Tā de xuésheng zuì rènzhēn le.
examples.english: His student is the most serious.

examples.chinese: 黄山 的 风景 最 美 了 。
examples.pinyin: Huángshān de fēngjǐng zuì měi le.
examples.english: Huang Mountain's landscape is the most beautiful.

examples.chinese: 老板 最 喜欢 你 了 ！
examples.pinyin: Lǎobǎn zuì xǐhuan nǐ le!
examples.english: The boss likes you the best!

examples.chinese: 你 最 怕 什么？
examples.pinyin: Nǐ zuì pà shénme?
examples.english: What do you most fear?

examples.chinese: 我 最 想 去 的 地方 是 西班牙 。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zuì xiǎng qù de dìfang shì Xībānyá.
examples.english: The place I most want to go to is Spain.

examples.chinese: 谁 最 了解 你？
examples.pinyin: Shéi zuì liǎojiě nǐ?
examples.english: Who knows you best?

examples.chinese: 她 最 讨厌 抽烟 的 男人 了。
examples.pinyin: Tā zuì tǎoyàn chōuyān de nánrén le.
examples.english: She hates men who smoke the most.

explanation: Pairing 最 (zuì) with a psychological verb like 喜欢 (xǐhuan) is a common way to talk about one's 'favorite'. It can be used with other verbs and adjectives to express the superlative degree, meaning 'the most'.

examples.chinese: 你 最 喜欢 什么 颜色 ？
examples.pinyin: Nǐ zuì xǐhuan shénme yánsè?
examples.english: What is your favorite color?

examples.chinese: 你 最 喜欢 什么 动物 ？
examples.pinyin: Nǐ zuì xǐhuan shénme dòngwù?
examples.english: What is your favorite animal?

explanation: 或者 (huòzhě) is used to connect choices or possibilities within a statement, similar to 'or' in English. It is used in declarative sentences, whereas 还是 (háishì) is used for 'or' in questions.

examples.chinese: 我 喝 咖啡 或者 茶， 都 行。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ hē kāfēi huòzhě chá, dōu xíng.
examples.english: I drink coffee or tea. Either is OK.

examples.chinese: 星期六 或者 星期天， 都 可以 。
examples.pinyin: Xīngqīliù huòzhě xīngqītiān, dōu kěyǐ.
examples.english: Saturday or Sunday are both OK.

examples.chinese: 今天 晚上 我 想 吃 披萨 或者 寿司。
examples.pinyin: Jīntiān wǎnshang wǒ xiǎng chī pīsà huòzhě shòusī.
examples.english: Tonight I would like to eat pizza or sushi.

examples.chinese: 周末 的 时候 ， 我 喜欢 在家 做 饭 或者 看 电影。
examples.pinyin: Zhōumò de shíhou, wǒ xǐhuan zài jiā zuò fàn huòzhě kàn diànyǐng.
examples.english: During the weekend, I like to cook or watch movies at home.

examples.chinese: 你 去 或者 她 去，都 可以。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ qù huòzhě tā qù, dōu kěyǐ.
examples.english: You go or she goes, either way is fine.

examples.chinese: 下班 以后 我 去 你 家 或者 你 来 我 家， 都 可以。
examples.pinyin: Xiàbān yǐhòu wǒ qù nǐ jiā huòzhě nǐ lái wǒ jiā, dōu kěyǐ.
examples.english: After work I will go to your house, or you can come to my house, either way is fine.

examples.chinese: 下 个 月 我 打算 去 杭州 或者 苏州 旅行。
examples.pinyin: Xià gè yuè wǒ dǎsuàn qù Hángzhōu huòzhě Sūzhōu lǚxíng.
examples.english: Next month I plan to go to Hangzhou or Suzhou to travel.

examples.chinese: 我们 可以 坐 飞机 或者 坐 高铁 去。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen kěyǐ zuò fēijī huòzhě zuò gāotiě qù.
examples.english: We can go by plane or by high-speed train.

examples.chinese: 晚饭 以后 我 喜欢 和 家人 聊天 或者 喝茶。
examples.pinyin: Wǎnfàn yǐhòu wǒ xǐhuan hé jiārén liáotiān huòzhě hē chá.
examples.english: After dinner I like to chat or drink tea with my family.

examples.chinese: 你 可以 用 手机 或者 电脑 上网。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ kěyǐ yòng shǒujī huòzhě diànnǎo shàngwǎng.
examples.english: You can use either a cell phone or computer to go online.

explanation: 那个 (nèige) is used as a filler word in Chinese, similar to 'um' or 'uh' in English. It can be inserted into sentences wherever a speaker needs to pause to think or search for a word.

examples.chinese: 那个 …… 我 不 和 你们一起 吃饭 了， 好 吗？
examples.pinyin: Nèige ... wǒ bù hé nǐmen yīqǐ chīfàn le, hǎo ma?
examples.english: So, ummm... I won't eat with you guys, OK?

examples.chinese: 我 想 吃 那个 …… 那个 …… 湖南 菜。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xiǎng chī nèige ... nèige ... Húnán cài.
examples.english: I want to eat that... ummm, you know... Hunan cuisine.

examples.chinese: 那个 …… 我 明天 不 来 了。
examples.pinyin: Nèige ... wǒ míngtiān bù lái le.
examples.english: Ummm... I'm not coming tomorrow.

examples.chinese: 那个 …… 这样 做 不 好 吧？
examples.pinyin: Nèige ... zhèyàng zuò bù hǎo ba?
examples.english: Ummm, it's not good to do it this way?

examples.chinese: 那个 …… 你 可以 做 我 的 女 朋友 吗？
examples.pinyin: Nèige ... nǐ kěyǐ zuò wǒ de nǚpéngyou ma?
examples.english: Like... could you be my girlfriend?

examples.chinese: 那个 …… 不好意思 ， 我 要 走 了。
examples.pinyin: Nèige ... bùhǎoyìsi, wǒ yào zǒu le.
examples.english: Ummmm... sorry, but I've gotta go.

examples.chinese: 她 很 漂亮 ， 就 像 那个 …… 明星 一样。
examples.pinyin: Tā hěn piàoliang, jiù xiàng nèige ... míngxīng yīyàng.
examples.english: She's very pretty, just like, you know, a celebrity.

examples.chinese: 我 想 看 看 你 买 的 那个 …… 那个 …… iPhone。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xiǎng kànkan nǐ mǎi de nèige ... nèige ... iPhone.
examples.english: I‘d like to take a look at your, ummm, you know... iPhone you bought.

examples.chinese: 那个 …… 我 要 去 开会 了。
examples.pinyin: Nèige ... wǒ yào qù kāihuì le.
examples.english: Ummm... I have to attend a meeting.

examples.chinese: 昨天 那个 …… 那个 …… 小笼包 真 好吃。
examples.pinyin: Zuótiān nèige ... nèige ... xiǎolóngbāo zhēn hǎochī.
examples.english: Yesterday the, you know, steamed soup dumplings were so delicious.

structure: Statement, 可是 / 但是 + [contrary statement]
explanation: There are two main words for 'but' in Chinese: 可是 (kěshì) and 但是 (dànshì). They are largely interchangeable and used to introduce a statement that contrasts with the previous one. 但是 (dànshì) is considered slightly more formal, while 可是 (kěshì) is more informal and can have a stronger tone.

examples.chinese: 我 喜欢 他， 可是 他 不 喜欢 我。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xǐhuan tā, kěshì tā bù xǐhuan wǒ.
examples.english: I like him, but he doesn't like me.

examples.chinese: 我 很 想 去， 但是 我 太 忙 了。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ hěn xiǎng qù, dànshì wǒ tài máng le.
examples.english: I really want to go, but I am too busy.

examples.chinese: 中文 很 有意思， 但是 也 很 难。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngwén hěn yǒuyìsi, dànshì yě hěn nán.
examples.english: Chinese is very interesting, but it is also very hard.

examples.chinese: 我 喜欢 这 件 衬衫， 可是 太 贵 了。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xǐhuan zhè jiàn chènshān, kěshì tài guì le.
examples.english: I like this shirt, but it is too expensive.

examples.chinese: 老板 昨天 给 他 打 电话， 可是 他 没 接。
examples.pinyin: Lǎobǎn zuótiān gěi tā dǎ diànhuà, kěshì tā méi jiē.
examples.english: The boss gave him a call yesterday, but he didn't answer.

examples.chinese: iPhone 很 好， 但是 我 没 钱 买。
examples.pinyin: iPhone hěn hǎo, dànshì wǒ méi qián mǎi.
examples.english: The iPhone is great, but I don't have the money to buy it.

examples.chinese: 你们 可以 在 这里 看书， 可是 不 可以 说话。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ kěyǐ zài zhèlǐ kàn shū, kěshì bù kěyǐ shuōhuà.
examples.english: You can read books here, but you can't talk.

examples.chinese: 你 可以 吃， 但是 不 可以 吃 太 多。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ kěyǐ chī, dànshì bù kěyǐ chī tài duō.
examples.english: You can eat, but you can't eat too much.

examples.chinese: 他 说 五点 来 见 我， 但是 他 没 来。
examples.pinyin: Tā shuō wǔdiǎn lái jiàn wǒ, dànshì tā méi lái.
examples.english: He said he would come to see me at five, but he didn't.

examples.chinese: 这 个 地方 很 漂亮， 但是 人 太 多 了。
examples.pinyin: Zhè ge dìfang hěn piàoliang, dànshì rén tài duō le.
examples.english: This place is beautiful, but there are too many people.

structure: Subj. + 跟 + Person + (一起) + Verb + Obj.
explanation: The preposition 跟 (gēn) is used to express 'with'. The '跟 + Person' phrase must come before the verb. The adverb 一起 (yīqǐ), meaning 'together', is often used with 跟 (gēn) to emphasize the joint nature of the action. For most uses, 跟 (gēn) is interchangeable with 和 (hé).

examples.chinese: 我 昨天 跟 朋友 去 酒吧 了。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zuótiān gēn péngyou qù jiǔbā le.
examples.english: I went to the bar with friends yesterday.

examples.chinese: 不要 跟 我 说话 ！
examples.pinyin: Bùyào gēn wǒ shuōhuà !
examples.english: Don't talk to me!

examples.chinese: 我 明天 要 跟 新 客户 见面 。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ míngtiān yào gēn xīn kèhù jiànmiàn .
examples.english: I'm going to meet new clients tomorrow.

examples.chinese: 你 什么 时候 跟 你 女朋友 结婚 ？
examples.pinyin: Nǐ shénme shíhou gēn nǐ nǚpéngyou jiéhūn ?
examples.english: When are you gonna marry your girlfriend?

examples.chinese: 你 喜欢 跟 你 父母 聊天 吗？
examples.pinyin: Nǐ xǐhuan gēn nǐ fùmǔ liáotiān ma?
examples.english: Do you like to talk with your parents?

examples.chinese: 你 想 跟 我 一起 去 吗？
examples.pinyin: Nǐ xiǎng gēn wǒ yīqǐ qù ma?
examples.english: Do you want to go with me?

examples.chinese: 请 你们 跟 老师 一起 读 。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng nǐmen gēn lǎoshī yīqǐ dú .
examples.english: Please read together with the teacher.

examples.chinese: 下周 谁 跟 老板 一起 出差 ？
examples.pinyin: Xiàzhōu shéi gēn lǎobǎn yīqǐ chūchāi ?
examples.english: Who is going on a business trip together with the boss next week?

examples.chinese: 结婚 以后，你 想 跟 父母 一起 住 吗？
examples.pinyin: Jiéhūn yǐhòu, nǐ xiǎng gēn fùmǔ yīqǐ zhù ma?
examples.english: Do you want live together with your parents after you get married?

examples.chinese: 今年 中秋节 你 会 跟 家人 一起 过 吗？
examples.pinyin: Jīnnián Zhōngqiūjié nǐ huì gēn jiārén yīqǐ guò ma?
examples.english: Are you going to spent this Mid-Autumn Festival with your family?

examples.chinese: 我 要 跟 你 见面 。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ yào gēn nǐ jiànmiàn .
examples.english: I want to meet (with) you.

examples.chinese: 跟 我 读 。
examples.pinyin: Gēn wǒ dú.
examples.english: Read after me.

structure: 以前, Subj. + Verb + Obj.  OR  Subj. + 以前 + Verb + Obj.
explanation: 以前 (yǐqián) is used to talk about actions or states that occurred at an unspecified time in the past. It can be placed either at the beginning of a sentence or after the subject.

examples.chinese: 以前 我 不 会 说 中文 。
examples.pinyin: Yǐqián wǒ bù huì shuō Zhōngwén.
examples.english: Before, I could not speak Chinese.

examples.chinese: 你 以前 住 在 哪儿？
examples.pinyin: Nǐ yǐqián zhù zài nǎr?
examples.english: Before, where did you live?

examples.chinese: 以前 我 不 认识 他。
examples.pinyin: Yǐqián wǒ bù rènshi tā.
examples.english: Before, I didn't know him.

examples.chinese: 以前 ，他 是 我们 的 客户 吗？
examples.pinyin: Yǐqián tā shì wǒmen de kèhù ma?
examples.english: Was he our client before?

examples.chinese: 以前 他 是 一 个 老师，现在 是 老板。
examples.pinyin: Yǐqián tā shì yī gè lǎoshī, xiànzài shì lǎobǎn.
examples.english: Before, he was a teacher. Now, he is a boss.

examples.chinese: 我 父母 以前 常常 跟 我 聊天。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ fùmǔ yǐqián chángcháng gēn wǒ liáotiān.
examples.english: Before, my parents often talked to me.

examples.chinese: 爸爸 以前 很 喜欢 抽烟。
examples.pinyin: Bàba yǐqián hěn xǐhuan chōuyān.
examples.english: Before, dad really liked smoking.

examples.chinese: 姐姐 以前 有 一 个 很有钱 的 男朋友。
examples.pinyin: Jiějie yǐqián yǒu yī gè hěn yǒuqián de nánpéngyou.
examples.english: My older sister had a very rich boyfriend before.

examples.chinese: 他们 以前 没有 钱，可是 很 快乐。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen yǐqián méiyǒu qián, kěshì hěn kuàilè.
examples.english: They didn't have much money before, but they were happy.

examples.chinese: 我男朋友 以前 在 美国 工作，现在 在 中国 工作。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ nánpéngyou yǐqián zài Měiguó gōngzuò, xiànzài zài Zhōngguó gōngzuò.
examples.english: Before, my boyfriend worked in America. Now, he works in China.

structure: (Subj.) + 刚才 + Verb Phrase  OR  刚才 + (Subj.) + Verb Phrase
explanation: 刚才 (gāngcái) is a time noun used to indicate that an action occurred very recently, equivalent to 'just now' or 'a moment ago'. It can be placed before the subject or after the subject (before the verb).

examples.chinese: 你 刚才 说 什么 了？
examples.pinyin: Nǐ gāngcái shuō shénme le?
examples.english: What did you just say?

examples.chinese: 刚才 谁 来 了？
examples.pinyin: Gāngcái shéi lái le?
examples.english: Who came just now?

examples.chinese: 刚才 你 去 哪儿 了？
examples.pinyin: Gāngcái nǐ qù nǎr le?
examples.english: Where did you go just now?

examples.chinese: 刚才 我 去 洗手间 了。
examples.pinyin: Gāngcái wǒ qù xǐshǒujiān le.
examples.english: I just went to the washroom.

examples.chinese: 老板 刚才 生气 了。
examples.pinyin: Lǎobǎn gāngcái shēngqì le.
examples.english: The boss just got angry.

examples.chinese: 你们 刚才 在 看 什么？
examples.pinyin: Nǐmen gāngcái zài kàn shénme?
examples.english: What were you looking at just now?

examples.chinese: 不好意思，我 刚才 出去 了。
examples.pinyin: Bùhǎoyìsi, wǒ gāngcái chūqù le.
examples.english: I'm sorry, I just now stepped out.

examples.chinese: 宝宝 刚才 哭 了。
examples.pinyin: Bǎobao gāngcái kū le.
examples.english: The baby just cried.

examples.chinese: 他们 刚才 去 开会 了。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen gāngcái qù kāihuì le.
examples.english: They just went to a meeting.

examples.chinese: 刚才 有 人 找 你。
examples.pinyin: Gāngcái yǒu rén zhǎo nǐ.
examples.english: Just now, there was someone looking for you.

explanation: 的时候 (de shíhou) is used to mean 'when' or 'at the time of'. It is attached to a verb, adjective, or noun phrase that specifies a time or condition, creating a time clause that sets the context for the main clause of the sentence.

examples.chinese: 你 不 在 的时候 ， 我 会 想 你。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ bù zài de shíhou, wǒ huì xiǎng nǐ.
examples.english: When you are not here, I will miss you.

explanation: Used to indicate the time when an action or state occurs, similar to 'when' or 'while' in English. The phrase before 的时候 can be a verb phrase, an adjective phrase, or a clause describing a situation.

examples.chinese: 你不在的时候，我会想你。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ bù zài de shíhou, wǒ huì xiǎng nǐ.
examples.english: When you are not here, I'll miss you.

examples.chinese: 我上大学的时候有很多女朋友。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ shàng dàxué de shíhou yǒu hěn duō nǚpéngyou.
examples.english: When I was in college, I had a lot of girlfriends.

examples.chinese: 小的时候，我不喜欢吃肉。
examples.pinyin: Xiǎo de shíhou, wǒ bù xǐhuan chī ròu.
examples.english: When I was little, I didn't like to eat meat.

examples.chinese: 老板工作的时候喜欢喝咖啡。
examples.pinyin: Lǎobǎn gōngzuò de shíhou xǐhuan hē kāfēi.
examples.english: When the boss works, he likes to drink coffee.

examples.chinese: 我生气的时候请你不要笑。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ shēngqì de shíhou qǐng nǐ bùyào xiào.
examples.english: Please don't laugh when I'm angry.

examples.chinese: 妈妈不在家的时候，我自己做饭。
examples.pinyin: Māma bù zài jiā de shíhou, wǒ zìjǐ zuòfàn.
examples.english: When mom is not home, I cook for myself.

examples.chinese: 下课的时候，我们常常在一起聊天。
examples.pinyin: Xiàkè de shíhou, wǒmen chángcháng yīqǐ liáotiān.
examples.english: We often chat after class.

examples.chinese: 吃东西的时候不要说话。
examples.pinyin: Chī dōngxi de shíhou bùyào shuōhuà.
examples.english: Don't talk while eating.

examples.chinese: 你开车的时候会打电话吗？
examples.pinyin: Nǐ kāichē de shíhou huì dǎ diànhuà ma?
examples.english: Do you talk on the phone when you're driving?

examples.chinese: 走路的时候不要玩手机。
examples.pinyin: Zǒulù de shíhou bùyào wán shǒujī.
examples.english: Don't play with your phone while walking.

grammar_point: After a specific time with 以后 (yǐhòu)
structure: Time + 以后, Subj. + Verb + Obj. / Verb + 以后, Subj. + Verb + Obj.
explanation: 以后 (yǐhòu) is used to describe events that happen after a specific time or action. The time can be a specific date, time, or an event/action.

examples.chinese: 下午三点以后，我不在家。
examples.pinyin: Xiàwǔ sāndiǎn yǐhòu, wǒ bù zài jiā.
examples.english: After three p.m., I will not be at home.

examples.chinese: 来中国以后，她认识了她的老公。
examples.pinyin: Lái Zhōngguó yǐhòu, tā rènshi le tā de lǎogōng.
examples.english: After coming to China, she met her husband.

examples.chinese: 她一个月以后开始上班。
examples.pinyin: Tā yī gè yuè yǐhòu kāishǐ shàngbān.
examples.english: After one month, she will start working.

examples.chinese: 吃完午饭以后，我们要开会。
examples.pinyin: Chī wán wǔfàn yǐhòu, wǒmen yào kāihuì.
examples.english: We are going to have a meeting after we finish lunch.

examples.chinese: 几年以后，我们公司会更大。
examples.pinyin: Jǐnián yǐhòu, wǒmen gōngsī huì gèng dà.
examples.english: In a few years, our company will be even bigger.

examples.chinese: 老板半个小时以后回来。
examples.pinyin: Lǎobǎn bàn gè xiǎoshí yǐhòu huílái.
examples.english: After half an hour, the boss will return.

examples.chinese: 下班以后你想跟我们一起去酒吧吗?
examples.pinyin: Xiàbān yǐhòu, nǐ xiǎng gēn wǒmen yīqǐ qù jiǔbā ma?
examples.english: After we get off work, would you like to go to a bar with us?

examples.chinese: 老板来了以后，大家都不说话了。
examples.pinyin: Lǎobǎn lái le yǐhòu, dàjiā dōu bù shuōhuà le.
examples.english: After the boss came, everyone stopped talking.

examples.chinese: 你到家以后给我打电话。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ dào jiā yǐhòu gěi wǒ dǎ diànhuà.
examples.english: After you get home, call me.

examples.chinese: 生病以后爸爸不喝酒了。
examples.pinyin: Shēngbìng yǐhòu, bàba bù hē jiǔ le.
examples.english: After he got sick, dad stopped drinking.

grammar_point: Before a specific time with 以前 (yǐqián)
structure: Time / Verb + 以前, Subj. + Verb + Obj.
explanation: 以前 (yǐqián) is used to talk about things that happened before a specific time or action. The time can be a specific point in time or an event.

examples.chinese: 吃饭以前，你洗手了吗？
examples.pinyin: Chī fàn yǐqián, nǐ xǐ shǒu le ma?
examples.english: Did you wash your hands before eating?

examples.chinese: 睡觉以前，不要吃东西。
examples.pinyin: Shuìjiào yǐqián, bù yào chī dōngxi.
examples.english: Don't eat anything before you go to sleep.

examples.chinese: 两年以前，你认识他吗？
examples.pinyin: Liǎngnián yǐqián, nǐ rènshi tā ma?
examples.english: Did you know him two years ago?

examples.chinese: 星期五以前，你要做完这些工作。
examples.pinyin: Xīngqīwǔ yǐqián, nǐ yào zuò wán zhèxiē gōngzuò.
examples.english: You need to finish this work before Friday.

examples.chinese: 上大学以前，你来过上海吗？
examples.pinyin: Shàng dàxué yǐqián, nǐ lái guo shànghǎi ma?
examples.english: Before you went to college, did you ever come to Shanghai?

examples.chinese: 结婚以前，你应该先买房子。
examples.pinyin: Jiéhūn yǐqián, nǐ yīnggāi xiān mǎi fángzi.
examples.english: Before getting married, you should first buy a house.

examples.chinese: 二十年以前，这里是一个小村子。
examples.pinyin: Èrshí nián yǐqián, zhèlǐ shì yī gè xiǎo cūnzi.
examples.english: Twenty years ago, this was a small village.

examples.chinese: 几个月以前，他们分手了。
examples.pinyin: Jǐ gè yuè yǐqián, tāmen fēnshǒu le.
examples.english: They broke up a few months ago.

examples.chinese: 毕业以前，我要找到工作。
examples.pinyin: Bìyè yǐqián, wǒ yào zhǎodào gōngzuò.
examples.english: I need to find a job before graduation.

examples.chinese: 当总统以前，Obama没有白头发。
examples.pinyin: Dāng zǒngtǒng yǐqián, Obama méiyǒu bái tóufa.
examples.english: Before he became the president, Obama didn't have white hair .

grammar_point: In the future in general with 以后 (yǐhòu)
structure: 以后 + Subj. + Verb + Obj. / Subj. + 以后 + Verb + Obj.
explanation: 以后 (yǐhòu) can be used to talk about events happening at some unspecified time in the future, similar to 'in the future' or 'later on'. It can be placed either at the beginning of the sentence or after the subject.

examples.chinese: 以后你们会想我吗？
examples.pinyin: Yǐhòu nǐmen huì xiǎng wǒ ma?
examples.english: In the future, will you miss me?

examples.chinese: 以后你想来中国吗？
examples.pinyin: Yǐhòu nǐ xiǎng lái Zhōngguó ma?
examples.english: In the future, do you want to come to China?

examples.chinese: 我以后不喝酒了。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ yǐhòu bù hē jiǔ le.
examples.english: I will not drink alcohol in the future.

examples.chinese: 我们以后不在这里工作了。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen yǐhòu bù zài zhèlǐ gōngzuò le.
examples.english: We will not work here in the future.

examples.chinese: 你儿子以后想做什么？
examples.pinyin: Nǐ érzi yǐhòu xiǎng zuò shénme?
examples.english: In the future, what does your son want to do?

examples.chinese: 以后你们想去哪儿工作？
examples.pinyin: Yǐhòu nǐmen xiǎng qù nǎr gōngzuò?
examples.english: In the future, where would you like to work?

examples.chinese: 以后我们会 有一些新的同事。
examples.pinyin: Yǐhòu wǒmen huì yǒu yīxiē xīn de tóngshì.
examples.english: We will have some new co-workers in the future.

examples.chinese: 以后你可以住在这里。
examples.pinyin: Yǐhòu nǐ kěyǐ zhù zài zhèlǐ.
examples.english: In the future, you can live here.

examples.chinese: 他们以后会结婚吗？
examples.pinyin: Tāmen yǐhòu huì jiéhūn ma?
examples.english: Will they get married in the future?

examples.chinese: 你以后不要跟他见面了。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ yǐhòu bù yào gēn tā jiànmiàn le.
examples.english: In the future, stop seeing him.

structure: Time + Subj. + Verb + Obj. / Subj. + Time + Verb + Obj.
explanation: In Chinese, time words (like 'yesterday', 'next week') must be placed before the verb. They can appear either at the beginning of the sentence before the subject, or directly after the subject.

examples.chinese: 昨天我去了酒吧。
examples.pinyin: Zuótiān wǒ qù le jiǔbā.
examples.english: Yesterday I went to the bar.

examples.chinese: 我昨天去了酒吧。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zuótiān qù le jiǔbā.
examples.english: I went to the bar yesterday.

examples.chinese: 下个星期他要回国。
examples.pinyin: Xià gè xīngqī tā yào huíguó.
examples.english: Next week he is going back to his country.

examples.chinese: 他下个星期要回国。
examples.pinyin: Tā xià gè xīngqī yào huíguó.
examples.english: He is going back to his country next week.

examples.chinese: 明年我要开一个公司。
examples.pinyin: Míngnián wǒ yào kāi yī gè gōngsī.
examples.english: Next year I want to open a company.

examples.chinese: 我明年要开一个公司。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ míngnián yào kāi yī gè gōngsī.
examples.english: I want to open a company next year.

examples.chinese: 下个月我们结婚吧？
examples.pinyin: Xià gè yuè wǒmen jiéhūn ba?
examples.english: Next month shall we get married?

examples.chinese: 我们下个月结婚吧？
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen xià gè yuè jiéhūn ba?
examples.english: Shall we get married next month?

examples.chinese: 现在你能来我办公室吗？
examples.pinyin: Xiànzài nǐ néng lái wǒ bàngōngshì ma?
examples.english: Now you can come to my office?

examples.chinese: 你现在能来我办公室吗？
examples.pinyin: Nǐ xiànzài néng lái wǒ bàngōngshì ma?
examples.english: Can you come to my office now?

explanation: To express an approximate number, you can simply state two sequential numbers in a row. This is similar to saying 'x or y' or 'about x' in English.

examples.chinese: 一两天
examples.pinyin: Yī liǎng tiān
examples.english: One or two days.

examples.chinese: 三四个人
examples.pinyin: Sān sì gè rén
examples.english: Three or four people

examples.chinese: 老板昨天喝了七八瓶啤酒。
examples.pinyin: Laobǎn zuótiān hē le qī bā píng píjiǔ.
examples.english: The boss drunk 7 or 8 bottles of beer yeterday.

examples.chinese: 这个词我们学过两三次了。
examples.pinyin: Zhè ge cí wǒmen xué guo liǎng sān cì le.
examples.english: We've studied this word two or three times now.

examples.chinese: 我等了你三四个小时。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ děng le nǐ sān sì ge xiǎoshí.
examples.english: I waited for you for three or four hours.

examples.chinese: 他们七八年没见面了。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen qī bā nián méi jiànmiàn le.
examples.english: They haven't seen each other for seven or eight years.

examples.chinese: 要做完这个工作需要一两个月。
examples.pinyin: Yào zuò wán zhè ge gōngzuò xūyào yī liǎng gè yuè.
examples.english: To complete this work, you need one to two months.

examples.chinese: 他们家的孩子五六岁了吧。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen jiā de háizi wǔ liù suì le ba.
examples.english: Their child is about five or six years old.

examples.chinese: 这件衣服只要七八十块钱。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiàn yīfu zhǐ yào qī bā shí kuài qián.
examples.english: This piece of clothing only needs (costs) seventy to eighty kuai.

examples.chinese: 这几本书花了我两三百。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jǐ běn shū huā le wǒ liǎng sān bǎi.
examples.english: These few books cost me two or three hundred kuai.

structure: Numbers are grouped in units of four digits, using 万 (wàn) for ten thousand and 亿 (yì) for a hundred million.
explanation: Chinese breaks down large numbers differently from English. Instead of grouping by thousands, Chinese groups numbers by tens of thousands (万, wàn). For numbers larger than one hundred million, the unit 亿 (yì) is used.

examples.chinese: 五万二千一百五十二
examples.pinyin: wǔ wàn liǎngqiān yībǎi wǔshí-èr

examples.chinese: 十万八千三百六十
examples.pinyin: shí wàn bāqiān sānbǎi liùshí

examples.chinese: 八十五万四千三百二十
examples.pinyin: bāshí-wǔ wàn sìqiān sānbǎi èrshí

examples.chinese: 二百九十一万四千六百八十
examples.pinyin: èrbǎi jiǔshí-yī wàn sìqiān liùbǎi bāshí

examples.chinese: 七百八十九万零二百九十八
examples.pinyin: qībǎi bāshí-jiǔ wàn líng èrbǎi jiǔshí-bā

examples.chinese: 二千七百二十一万四千八百九十六
examples.pinyin: èrqiān qībǎi èrshí-yī wàn sìqiān bābǎi jiǔshí-liù

examples.chinese: 五千三百七十九万八千两百五十
examples.pinyin: wǔqiān sānbǎi qīshí-jiǔ wàn bāqiān liǎngbǎi wǔshí

examples.chinese: 四亿一千四百二十九万四千一百八十二
examples.pinyin: sì yì yīqiān sìbǎi èrshí-jiǔ wàn sìqiān yībǎi bāshí-èr

examples.chinese: 十三亿两千六百八十万
examples.pinyin: shísān yì liǎngqiān liùbǎi bāshí wàn

examples.chinese: 两百五十一亿五千八百三十六万七千二百
examples.pinyin: liǎngbǎi wǔshí-yī yì wǔqiān bābǎi sānshí-liù wàn qīqiān èrbǎi

structure: x 点 零 y 分
explanation: In Chinese, when the minute is under 10, the word 零 (líng) is often used after 点 (diǎn). For example, 2:07 would be said as “两点零七分” (liǎng diǎn líng qī fēn). However, note that when speaking, it is very common for most Chinese people take out the “分 (fēn)” at the end of the time.

examples.chinese: 两点零九分
examples.pinyin: liǎng diǎn líng jiǔ fēn

examples.chinese: 三点零八分
examples.pinyin: sān diǎn líng bā fēn

examples.chinese: 五点零三分
examples.pinyin: wǔ diǎn líng sān fēn

examples.chinese: 七点零一分
examples.pinyin: qī diǎn líng yī fēn

examples.chinese: 八点零五分
examples.pinyin: bā diǎn líng wǔ fēn

explanation: In Chinese, quarter hours are expressed for x:15 (一刻) and x:45 (三刻). The word 刻 (kè) for 'quarter hour' comes after 点 (diǎn). You can also use 十五分 (shíwǔ fēn) for '15 minutes' or 四十五分 (sìshíwǔ fēn) for '45 minutes'.

examples.chinese: 九点一刻
examples.pinyin: jiǔ diǎn yī kè

examples.chinese: 七点一刻
examples.pinyin: qī diǎn yī kè

examples.chinese: 十二点一刻
examples.pinyin: shí-èr diǎn yī kè

examples.chinese: 一点三刻
examples.pinyin: yī diǎn sān kè

examples.chinese: 六点三刻
examples.pinyin: liù diǎn sān kè

grammar_point: Expressing minutes to the hour with 差 (chā)
structure: 差 + minutes + 分 + hour + 点
explanation: When expressing how many minutes it will be until the next full hour, you put 差 (chā) in front of the time expression.

examples.chinese: 差十分两点
examples.pinyin: chā shí fēn liǎng diǎn
examples.english: ten minutes til 2 o'clock

examples.chinese: 差五分三点
examples.pinyin: chā wǔ fēn sān diǎn
examples.english: five minutes til 3 o'clock

examples.chinese: 差一分十二点
examples.pinyin: chā yī fēn shí-èr diǎn
examples.english: one minute til 12 o'clock

examples.chinese: 差五分八点半
examples.pinyin: chā wǔ fēn bā diǎn bàn
examples.english: five minutes til 8:30

examples.chinese: 差两分十点半
examples.pinyin: chā liǎng fēn shí diǎn bàn
examples.english: two minutes til 10:30

explanation: One of the definitions of the common character 几 (jǐ) is 'several,' 'a couple' or 'a few.' It's an uncertain number that is at least more than one, but less than ten. The simplest way to use 几 (jǐ) is to use it directly with a measure word. It means 'a few,' less than ten or so, things.

examples.chinese: 桌子上有几本书。
examples.pinyin: Zhuōzi shàng yǒu jǐ běn shū.
examples.english: There are a few books on the table.

examples.chinese: 只有几个人去了那个聚会。
examples.pinyin: Zhǐyǒu jǐ gè rén qù le nà ge jùhuì.
examples.english: Only a few people went to that gathering.

examples.chinese: 从上海到东京坐飞机只要几个小时。
examples.pinyin: Cóng Shànghǎi dào Dōngjīng zuò fēijī zhǐ yào jǐ gè xiǎoshí.
examples.english: Flying from Shanghai to Tokyo only takes a few hours.

examples.chinese: 我每天都要喝几杯咖啡。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ měi tiān dōu yào hē jǐ bēi kāfēi.
examples.english: Every day I have to drink a couple cups of coffee.

examples.chinese: 老板今天开了几个重要的会。
examples.pinyin: Lǎobǎn jīntiān kāi le jǐ gè zhòngyào de huì.
examples.english: The boss had a few important meetings today.

structure: 几 + 十 + Measure Word + Noun
explanation: It is similar to how in English we can say, 'a few dozen' or 'a couple dozen,' though in this case instead of 'twelves of something' we are saying 'tens of something.'

examples.chinese: 他只想学几十个汉字。
examples.pinyin: Tā zhǐ xiǎng xué jǐ shí ge Hànzì.
examples.english: He only wants to study a few dozen Chinese characters.

examples.chinese: 我们公司有几十个员工。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen gōngsī yǒu jǐ shí ge yuángōng.
examples.english: Our company has a few dozen employees.

examples.chinese: 他写过几十本书，我都喜欢。
examples.pinyin: Tā xiě guo jǐ shí běn shū, wǒ dōu xǐhuan.
examples.english: He wrote a few dozen books. I like them all.

examples.chinese: 这个年轻的演员演了几十部电影。我都喜欢。
examples.pinyin: Zhè ge niánqīng de yǎnyuán yǎn le jǐ shí bù diànyǐng. Wǒ dōu xǐhuan.
examples.english: This young actor has acted in dozens of movies. I like them all.

examples.chinese: 老板在国外有几十套房子。
examples.pinyin: Lǎobǎn zài guówài yǒu jǐ shí tào fángzi.
examples.english: The boss has a few dozen houses abroad.

structure: 几 + 百/千/万 + Measure Word + Noun
explanation: In Chinese we can put 几 (jǐ) together with 百 (bǎi), 千 (qiān), or 万 (wàn), just like how in English we might say, 'a few hundred' or a 'few thousand.'

examples.chinese: 妈妈每个月都给我几百块钱。
examples.pinyin: Māma měi gè yuè dōu gěi wǒ jǐ bǎi kuài qián.
examples.english: Mom gives me a couple hundred dollars every month.

examples.chinese: 这个月我们卖了几千本书。
examples.pinyin: Zhè ge yuè wǒmen mài le jǐ qiān běn shū.
examples.english: We sold a couple thousand books this month.

examples.chinese: 几百家外国公司参加了这个大会。
examples.pinyin: Jǐ bǎi jiā wàiguó gōngsī cānjiā le zhè ge dàhuì.
examples.english: Several hundred foreign companies attended this conference.

examples.chinese: 这篇文章有几万个字，太长了。
examples.pinyin: Zhè piān wénzhāng yǒu jǐ wàn gè zì, tài cháng le.
examples.english: This article has tens of thousands of characters. It's too long.

examples.chinese: 我认识一个朋友，她有几百双高跟鞋。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ rènshi yīge péngyou, tā yǒu jǐ bǎi shuāng gāogēnxié.
examples.english: I have a friend that has a couple hundred high-heeled shoes.

explanation: This use of 了 (le) is about indicating a change of state (了2). In other words, there is now a new situation, or there is about to be a new situation. When used in this way, 了(le) is placed at the end of the sentence to show that the whole statement describes a new situation.

examples.chinese: 下雨了。
examples.pinyin: Xià yǔ le.
examples.english: It's raining.

examples.chinese: 妈妈老了。
examples.pinyin: Māma lǎo le.
examples.english: Mom is old.

examples.chinese: 你胖了。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ pàng le.
examples.english: You've gotten fat.

examples.chinese: 家里没有牛奶了。
examples.pinyin: Jiālǐ méiyǒu niúnǎi le.
examples.english: We don‘t have any milk at home.

examples.chinese: 爸爸今年50岁了。
examples.pinyin: Bàba jīnnián wǔshí suì le.
examples.english: Dad is 50 years old this year.

examples.chinese: 手机没电了。
examples.pinyin: Shǒujī méidiàn le.
examples.english: The cell phone ran out of power.

examples.chinese: 宝宝会说话了。
examples.pinyin: Bǎobao huì shuōhuà le.
examples.english: The baby can speak.

examples.chinese: 你哥哥有女朋友了吗？
examples.pinyin: Nǐ gēge yǒu nǚpéngyou le ma?
examples.english: Does your older brother have a girlfriend?

examples.chinese: 我男朋友找到新工作了。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ nánpéngyou zhǎo dào xīn gōngzuò le.
examples.english: My boyfriend found a new job.

examples.chinese: 你老婆怀孕了吗？
examples.pinyin: Nǐ lǎopo huáiyùn le ma?
examples.english: Is your wife pregnant?

explanation: The particle 吧 (ba) can be used to concede a point. That is, 吧 (ba) can be used to accept or agree with something that you're not particularly happy about, the way we might use 'all right' or 'fine then' in English. This usage is placed on the end of a sentence or statement.

examples.chinese: 好吧，我们可以看看别的。
examples.pinyin: Hǎo ba, wǒmen kěyǐ kànkan biéde.
examples.english: All right, we can take a look at something else.

examples.chinese: 行吧。
examples.pinyin: Xíng ba.
examples.english: All right.

examples.chinese: 好吧，但是明天一定要买到。
examples.pinyin: Hǎo ba, dànshì míngtiān yídìng yào mǎi dào.
examples.english: Fine, but tomorrow we definitely have to buy it.

examples.chinese: 行吧，但是不能带女孩。
examples.pinyin: Xíng ba, dànshì bù néng dài nǚhái.
examples.english: All right, but you can't bring girls.

examples.chinese: 好吧，那你好好休息。
examples.pinyin: Hǎo ba, nà nǐ hǎohāo xiūxi.
examples.english: All right, rest well then.

explanation: While 已经 (yǐjīng) means 'already' and is used with 了 (le), the feeling of 'already' can also be expressed with 了 (le) alone, typically in response to a preceding question or statement.

examples.chinese: 他走了。
examples.pinyin: Tā zǒu le.
examples.english: He (already) left.

examples.chinese: 他们工作了。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen gōngzuò le.
examples.english: They (already) work.

examples.chinese: 谢谢，我们有车了。
examples.pinyin: Xièxie, wǒmen yǒu chē le.
examples.english: Thanks. We (already) have a car.

examples.chinese: 他知道了。
examples.pinyin: Tā zhīdao le.
examples.english: He (already) knows.

examples.chinese: 我问了。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ wèn le.
examples.english: I (already) asked.

structure: (已经 +) 不 / 没(有) + [Verb Phrase] + 了
explanation: In a negative sentence, the sentence-final 了 (le) can take on the meaning of '(not) anymore' or 'no longer.' The word 已经 (yǐjīng), which means 'already,' may or may not accompany it.

examples.chinese: 没有纸了。
examples.pinyin: Méiyǒu zhǐ le.
examples.english: There's no paper anymore.

examples.chinese: 你不喜欢我了？
examples.pinyin: Nǐ bù xǐhuan wǒ le?
examples.english: You don't like me anymore?

examples.chinese: 我不想吃了。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ bù xiǎng chī le.
examples.english: I don't want to eat anymore.

examples.chinese: 你们不能喝了。
examples.pinyin: Nǐmen bù néng hē le.
examples.english: You can't drink anymore.

examples.chinese: 我已经不住这里了。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ yǐjīng bù zhù zhèlǐ le.
examples.english: I don't live here anymore.

examples.chinese: 我们都没有钱了。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen dōu méiyǒu qián le.
examples.english: We don't have any more money.

examples.chinese: 他已经不在这儿工作了。
examples.pinyin: Tā yǐjīng bù zài zhèr gōngzuò le.
examples.english: He doesn't work here anymore.

examples.chinese: 他已经不是我老板了。
examples.pinyin: Tā yǐjīng bù shì wǒ lǎobǎn le.
examples.english: He is not my boss anymore.

examples.chinese: 他们已经不在一起了。
examples.pinyin: Tamen yǐjīng bù zài yīqǐ le.
examples.english: They are no longer together.

examples.chinese: 生病以后，爸爸不能喝酒了。
examples.pinyin: Shēngbìng yǐhòu, bàba bù néng hē jiǔ le.
examples.english: Dad can no longer drink after falling ill.

explanation: In many common expressions, 了 (le) is used in place of the word for 'now' (现在 xiànzài). This pattern is a specific application of the 'change of state' usage of 了.

examples.chinese: 知道了。
examples.pinyin: Zhīdao le.
examples.english: Got it. / I see.

examples.chinese: 懂了。
examples.pinyin: Dǒng le.
examples.english: Now I understand.

examples.chinese: 吃饭了！
examples.pinyin: Chī fàn le!
examples.english: Time to eat!

examples.chinese: 我走了。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zǒu le.
examples.english: I'm leaving now.

examples.chinese: 他来了。
examples.pinyin: Tā lái le.
examples.english: He's coming over now. / He's on the way.

examples.chinese: 上课了！
examples.pinyin: Shàng kè le!
examples.english: Class begins now!

examples.chinese: 我去睡觉了。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ qù shuìjiào le.
examples.english: I'm going to bed now.

examples.chinese: 快点儿，开会了！
examples.pinyin: Kuài diǎnr, kāihuì le!
examples.english: Hurry up, it's time for the meeting now!

examples.chinese: 该你了。
examples.pinyin: Gāi nǐ le.
examples.english: It's your turn now.

examples.chinese: 电影开始了！
examples.pinyin: Diànyǐng kāishǐ le!
examples.english: The movie is starting now!

explanation: One of the most common uses of the particle 了 (le) is to express the completion of an action (perfective aspect). This is about whether the action is complete in a certain time frame, not necessarily that it happened in the past. To indicate completeness, 了 (le) goes directly after the verb.

examples.chinese: 你今天早上吃了什么？
examples.pinyin: Nǐ jīntiān zǎoshang chī le shénme?
examples.english: What did you eat this morning?

examples.chinese: 他买了一个新手机。
examples.pinyin: Tā mǎi le yī gè xīn shǒujī.
examples.english: He bought a new cell phone.

examples.chinese: 昨天晚上我看见了UFO。
examples.pinyin: Zuótiān wǎnshang wǒ kànjiàn le UFO.
examples.english: I saw a UFO last night.

examples.chinese: 我学了两年中文。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xué le liǎng nián Zhōngwén.
examples.english: I studied Chinese for two years.

examples.chinese: 今年夏天我跟我男朋友去了台湾。
examples.pinyin: Jīnnián xiàtiān wǒ gēn wǒ nánpéngyou qù le Táiwān.
examples.english: I went to Taiwan with my boyfriend this summer.

examples.chinese: 你到了告诉我。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ dào le gàosu wǒ.
examples.english: When you have arrived, tell me.

examples.chinese: 老板走了以后，你们可以走。
examples.pinyin: Lǎobǎn zǒu le yǐhòu nǐmen kěyǐ zǒu.
examples.english: After the boss has left, you may leave.

examples.chinese: 你找到了以后，给我打电话。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ zhǎo dào le yǐhòu, gěi wǒ dǎ diànhuà.
examples.english: After you have found it, give me a call.

examples.chinese: 你们吃了饭以后，可以出去。
examples.pinyin: Nǐmen chī le fàn yǐhòu, kěyǐ chūqù.
examples.english: After you have eaten your food, you can go out.

examples.chinese: 下了课以后，我要问老师一些问题。
examples.pinyin: Xià le kè yǐhòu, wǒ yào wèn lǎoshī yīxiē wènti.
examples.english: After class is over, I need to ask the teacher a few questions.

explanation: The aspect particle 过 (guò) is used to indicate that an action has been experienced in the past. What this expresses is that the verb has been done at least once before, without specifying a particular time. 过 (guò) is used to talk about whether something has ever happened - whether it has been experienced.

examples.chinese: 你 学 过 中文 吗？
examples.pinyin: Nǐ xué guo Zhōngwén ma?
examples.english: Have you ever studied Chinese?

examples.chinese: 你 见 过 那 个 人 吗？
examples.pinyin: Nǐ jiàn guo nà ge rén ma?
examples.english: Have you seen that person before?

examples.chinese: 我们 来 过 这 个 地方。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen lái guo zhè ge dìfang.
examples.english: We've been to this place before.

examples.chinese: 我 也 吃 过 日本菜。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ yě chī guo Rìběn cài.
examples.english: I've also eaten Japanese food before.
